name: Ribs
steps: Remove membrane from back of ribs
Mix 3 Tbsp Mustard, 3 Tbsp Worcestershire, 30 drops Smoke
Rub Ribs down with the liquidy mixture until very thinly coated
Mix Smoked Paprika, Chili, 3 Tbsp Garlic, 1.5 Tbsp Onion, Salt
Also mix in Black Pepper and Cayenne
Thoroughly coat Ribs with dry rub until every inch is covered
Cover Ribs and let sit in fridge over night
Put tin foil on a pan (enough to cover both racks multiple times)
Place Ribs on an oven-safe metal grate (for breathing)
Place the grid on the foil, so it goes pan - foil - grate - ribs
Mix Apple Juice and 30 drops Smoke
Pour over the Ribs so it trickles all over them and lands in the foil
Preheat oven to 250F
Wrap the liquid/grate/ribs tightly in the tin foil, no holes
Bottom to top, it should go pan - (foil - grate - ribs - foil)
Put in oven for 2.5 hours
Once the Ribs are done in the oven, pull the pan out
Rip off the top layers of tin foil and baste the ribs with the sauce
Put back in oven for 1:20, basting the ribs every 20 minutes
Set the oven to 450F and watch until a bit carmalized (~5 minutes)
Pull the ribs out and let rest for 20 min
comments: Don't forget to remove the membrane!
Don't trim off all the extra meat on the cut, it's still good! It's just not pretty.
Re-work once you have a way to smoke meat - oven is not ideal
